EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Steam Power Generation System (Boiler Zone) at (8.0, 20.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Boiler at (8.0, 20.5)  
 – Role: Produces steam fueled by coal.  
 – Status: WORKING; Fuel: {'coal': 8}.
• Extra Steam Engine at (11.5, 18.5)  
 – Role: Converts steam to electrical energy.  
 – Status: NOT_CONNECTED; Energy: 0.0.
• Offshore Pump at (1.5, 32.5)  
 – Role: Supplies water to the boiler.  
 – Status: WORKING; Connected to the boiler via a pipe group (24 pipes were used).

### Iron Ore Mining Operation at (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of the following entities:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0)  
 – Function: Extracts iron ore.  
 – Status: WORKING; Fuel: {'coal': 7}; Energy produced: 2666.67; Drop position: (-14.5, -48.5).
• Belt Group at (-14.5, -48.5)  
 – Details: Input from a Belt at (-14.5, -48.5) and output to a Belt at (-9.5, -46.5).  
 – Status: WORKING; Inventory: {'iron-ore': 1}; Composed of 8 belts.
• Belt Group at (-16.5, -47.5)  
 – Details: Input from a Belt at (-16.5, -47.5) and output to a Belt at (-15.5, -48.5).  
 – Status: WORKING; Inventory: {'iron-ore': 11}; Composed of 3 belts.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Pipe Connection Errors:
 – Before attempting any connection, verify that both source and target connection points are unobstructed, correctly aligned, and that the available pipe count meets the calculated requirement.
• Inventory and Placement Issues:
 – Ensure the required entity (e.g. burner mining drill) exists in inventory before placement.  
 – Confirm that sufficient fuel (coal) is present prior to refuelling operations.  
 – Check that the buildable tile is within the permissible placement range (stay within the maximum allowed distance).
• Crafting Ingredient Shortages:
 – Prior to initiating crafting (such as for a burner mining drill), validate that all sub-ingredients—including those needed for intermediary items like iron-gear-wheels—are available or craftable (note that iron-plate may require a furnace or production facility).
• Entity Retrieval Errors:
 – If an expected entity (for example, a wooden chest) is not found at its target position, perform a search within an appropriate radius to locate the correct instance.
• Attribute Access Errors:
 – Access object properties directly instead of invoking them as functions to avoid attribute access mistakes.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────────
get_connection_amount(boiler: Entity, extra_se: Entity, connection_type: Prototype) -> int  
 – Determines the required number of pipes to connect two entities; raises an exception if connectivity or spatial conditions are not met.

place_entity(entity_type: Prototype, position: Position, direction: Direction) -> Entity  
 – Attempts to place an entity of the specified type at the given position and orientation; fails if the tile is occupied or if the necessary item is absent from inventory.

craft_item(item: Prototype, quantity: int) -> int  
 – Initiates crafting for a specified item and quantity; throws an exception if essential sub-ingredients or an operational production/smelting facility is missing.

Important Variables:
• inventory: dict[str, int] — Represents the current inventory (e.g. includes 'coal': 10, 'wooden-chest': 1, etc.).
• boiler: Entity — Refers to the boiler at (8.0, 20.5).
• extra_se: Entity — Denotes the extra steam engine at (11.5, 18.5).
• new_buildable_area: BuildableArea — Used to determine available buildable regions via its center property.
